title: Top 10: family-friendly hotels in Majorca
text: Viva Zafiro Alcudia, Majorca The hotel sits alongside Puerto de Alcudia, which is a family resort with a lovely beach in the north-east of Majorca. The five-star resort offers primarily all-inclusive holidays that will appeal to families who put their kids’ happiness first but don’t want to sacrifice grown-up style and luxury. There are three kids’ clubs for different ages with activities throughout the day. Children can also have lunch with the assistants. Babysitters and nannies can be arranged. Read the full review: Viva Zafiro Alcudia, Majorca Read more: the best hotels in Majorca Iberostar Cala Millor, Majorca The hotel is right on the sea at the southern end of the resort of Cala Millor. You can swim off the rocks in front of the hotel, or walk for two minutes to the long sandy beach, where the calm water makes it ideal for small children and water sports. A lot of guests are on all-inclusive but you can choose the deal that suits you. Rooms have sofa beds and there are clubs for different age groups with activities throughout the day. Cots and highchairs are available. Read the full review: Iberstar Cala Millor, Majorca Hotel Bonsol Resort & Spa, Majorca The Bonsol is a four-star hotel that has been run by the Xamena family for more than 60 years. The style is resolutely traditional with a bit of a medieval castle feel – no designer gimmickry here. The hotel is arranged in several buildings down the cliff, linked by lifts and paths. In summer there is a team to look after kids from 10am until 9pm, including lots of activities and having dinner with them at 6pm. Babysitting is also available. Read the full review: Hotel Bonsol Resort & Spa, Majorca Read more: the best hotels in Majorca Hotel Sis Pins, Majorca The Sis Pins is a family-run hotel with a three-star rating and a five-star view right on the front in Port de Pollença. While not overburdened with facilities or anything vaguely trendy, the warm atmosphere and truly splendid location make it a very attractive place to stay. Cots are free and an extra bed for a child sharing with two adults costs 50 per cent of the per person rate. It's a lovely place for a traditional seaside holiday with extended family. Read the full review: Hotel Sis Pins, Majorca Hotel Esplendido, Majorca Overlooking the gorgeous beach in Port de Sóller, the four-star Espléndido is a smart hotel that is equally popular with young families and older people alike. The 73 rooms are spread over five floors with permutations to suit couples, families and groups of friends. There is a kids’ menu and plenty of pools and beach toys. The Macs in the lobby keep the older children amused. Babysitting is available, though do take note of the child policy in the restaurants. Read the full review: Hotel Esplendido, Majorca Read more: the best hotels in Majorca Club Pollentia Resort, Majorca Outdoorsy types will feel right at home at the Club Pollentia Resort, where there is a wealth of activities on offer within the hotel, out on the water, or in the countryside. Set in extensive gardens, this is a great base for big families, couples or groups of friends who want to combine sunbathing with more active pursuits such as cycling without spending a fortune. A lot of the rooms have sofa beds. There are clubs for different age ranges from babies to teenagers. Read the full review: Club Pollentia Resort, Majorca Grupotel Gran Vista, Majorca With spacious apartments, large gardens and reasonable rates, the four-star Grupotel Gran Vista is popular with families with young children. There is plenty to keep different ages amused in the hotel, and a safe sandy beach is nearby too. Set in grounds with large areas of grass for sunbathing and playing, there is a laidback atmosphere where the children splash in the pool and the adults relax under the pine trees. Read more for the full review: Grupotel Gran Vista, Majorca Read more: the best hotels in Majorca Viva Cala Mesquida Resort, Majorca The Viva Cala Mesquida Resort is a four-star resort with great facilities for all the family. It's modern and practical but perfectly pleasant with a village feel. There are five pools, some adults only, one just for children. There are also tennis courts, bikes are available for hire and scubadiving and other watersports can be arranged. Kids’ activities include all sorts of sports, riding, painting, discos, games and a lot of pirate-related fun. Read the full review: Viva Cala Mesquida Resort, Majorca Blau Colonia Sant Jordi Resort & Spa, Majorca The hotel is close to the beach at Es Trenc, one of the most beautiful stretches of coastline on the island. The low-rise buildings and huge grounds with lakes and pine trees mean it has a different atmosphere from a lot of package-tour complexes on the island. There are three outdoor pools and a wide range of activities for children. Windsurfing and other watersports can be arranged, as well as tennis tuition on the hotel’s seven clay courts. Read the full review: Blau Colonia Sant Jordi Resort & Spa, Majorca Hotel Riu Bravo, Majorca The four-star Riu Bravo is a newly revamped, all-inclusive hotel near the sea in the resort of Playa de Palma. Contemporary design, smiling staff and above-average restaurants make it a relaxing place to stay at a reasonable price. The hotel is divided between two buildings with the main pool in between. It is modern and stylish with clean lines, light colours and a feeling of space everywhere. There are sofa-beds in a lot of the rooms and family rooms have two bedrooms.
